value.halfverse:
and are so far from my cry
 and from the words of my distress?
value.verse: My God, my God, why have you forsaken me? *

value.halfverse: by night as well, but I find no rest.
value.verse: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but you do not answer; *

value.halfverse: enthroned upon the praises of Israel.
value.verse: Yet you are the Holy One, *

value.halfverse: they trusted, and you delivered them.
value.verse: Our forefathers put their trust in you; *
They cried out to you and were delivered; *
value.halfverse: they trusted in you and were not put to shame.
scorned by all and despised by the people.
value.verse: But as for me, I am a worm and no man, *

value.halfverse: they curl their lips and wag their heads, saying,
value.verse: All who see me laugh me to scorn; *
“He trusted in the LORD; let him deliver him; *
value.halfverse: let him rescue him, if he delights in him.”

value.verse: Yet you are he who took me out of the womb, *
value.halfverse: and kept me safe upon my mother’s breast.
you were my God when I was still in my mother’s womb.
value.verse: I have been entrusted to you ever since I was born; *
Be not far from me, for trouble is near, *
value.halfverse: and there is none to help.
strong bulls of Bashan surround me.
value.verse: Many young bulls encircle me; *
They open wide their jaws at me, *
value.halfverse: like a ravening and a roaring lion.

value.verse:
I am poured out like water;
all my bones are out of joint; *
value.halfverse: my heart within my breast is melting wax.
and you have laid me in the dust of the grave.
value.verse:
My mouth is dried out like a pot-sherd;
my tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth; *

value.halfverse:
they pierce my hands and my feet;
 I can count all my bones.
value.verse:
Packs of dogs close me in,
and gangs of evildoers circle around me; *

value.halfverse:
they divide my garments among them;
 they cast lots for my clothing.
value.verse: They stare and gloat over me; *

value.halfverse: you are my strength; hasten to help me.
value.verse: Be not far away, O LORD; *

value.halfverse: my life from the power of the dog.
value.verse: Save me from the sword, *

value.halfverse: my wretched body from the horns of wild bulls.
value.verse: Save me from the lion’s mouth, *

value.halfverse: in the midst of the congregation I will praise you.
value.verse: I will declare your Name to my brethren; *
Praise the LORD, you that fear him; *
value.halfverse:
stand in awe of him, O offspring of Israel;
 all you of Jacob’s line, give glory.
but when they cry to him he hears them.
value.verse:
For he does not despise nor abhor the poor in their poverty;
neither does he hide his face from them; *
My praise is of him in the great assembly; *
value.halfverse: I will perform my vows in the presence of those who worship him.

value.verse:
The poor shall eat and be satisfied,
and those who seek the LORD shall praise him: *
value.halfverse: “May your heart live for ever!”

value.verse: All the ends of the earth shall remember and turn to the LORD, *
value.halfverse: and all the families of the nations bow before him.

value.verse: For kingship belongs to the LORD; *
value.halfverse: he rules over the nations.

value.verse: To him alone all who sleep in the earth bow down in worship; *
value.halfverse: all who go down to the dust fall before him.

value.verse:
My soul shall live for him;
my descendants shall serve him; *
value.halfverse: they shall be known as the LORD’S for ever.
the saving deeds that he has done.
value.verse: They shall come and make known to a people yet unborn *
